image.altText: Erin Patterson passes her phone to police during a search of her home in August 2023.

props.synopsis: The jury in Erin Patterson's trial sat through weeks of evidence before convicting her of murder. Here's some of the key pieces shown to the jury during the trial.

title.children: Leftovers, a dehydrator and CCTV: The evidence that convicted Erin Patterson

image.altText: Child's hand on play equipment

props.synopsis: Kids face down asleep in hoodies, electrical sockets exposed and one child locked in a shed. Documents reveal disturbing revelations from inside Australia's childcare sector in crisis.

title.children: 'Suffocation risk' to kids among fresh new claims about childcare sector in crisis

image.altText: A woman sits in a chair in a hospital with an IV in her arm, which rests on a pillor. She is looking down at her phone.

props.synopsis: There are ways to change the steep cancer trajectories that gen X and millennials might be on.

title.children: Rising cancer rates for under 50s are a wake-up call. We must do better

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a blue suit and white USA cap waving with his right arm raised while about to board Air Force One

props.synopsis: The US president confirmed the new levies by posting the letters he sent to world leaders on social media.

title.children: Trump announces swathes of new tariffs for countries around the world

image.altText: A young male tennis player reaching out to hit a ball with his racket.

props.synopsis: The Aussie took a commanding lead in the first set, before the 24-time grand slam winner staged a comeback at Wimbledon.

title.children: Alex De Minaur defeated by Novak Djokovic at Wimbledon

image.altText: A plate with a smattering of green beans and beef Wellington, and a knife and fork.

props.synopsis: Two years ago, Erin Patterson was a mother of two from a regional town who lived a quiet life. Now, the 50-year-old has been found guilty of murdering three people with death cap mushrooms, in a trial that's made global headlines.

title.children: As Erin's guests prayed for her health, a deadly toxin began its work

image.altText: Qantas Departure sign outside airport terminal

props.synopsis: The airline says it has contacted the Australian Federal Police and are working to verify the contact, less than a week after the data of up to 6 million customers was breached in an online attack.

title.children: Qantas 'contacted by potential cybercriminal' after data attack

image.altText: Woman holds folder and water bottle in remote community

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Coroner Elisabeth Armitage has handed down her long-awaited findings from an inquest into the 2019 police shooting death of Kumanjayi Walker in Yuendumu.

title.children: Coroner can't rule out officer's racism contributed in Kumanjayi Walker's death

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie sitting in a chair.

props.synopsis: Roman Starovoyt, who the Kremlin said had been "relieved of the post of Minister of Transport", was found with a gunshot wound.

title.children: Russian minister sacked by Putin found dead in car

image.altText: Unidentified child's hands playing with building bricks.

props.synopsis: Thousands of students are getting fast-tracked qualifications to work in childcare centres and it's compromising safety standards, experts warn.

title.children: Documents expose disturbing details about next generation of childcare students

image.altText: A cabin with a tree fallen down with the words Camp Mystic across the front of the roof.

props.synopsis: For nearly a century, Camp Mystic was a summer paradise for young girls in Texas. It is now the site of one of the deadliest flood disasters in the US state's recent history.

title.children: Camp Mystic was a summer paradise. Flood waters ended all that in minutes

image.altText: Premier Jacinta Allan standing in front of a synagogue speaking to press.

props.synopsis: Premier Jacinta Allan says a new taskforce will work to crack down on antisemitism after a synagogue in Melbourne's east was set on fire on Friday.

title.children: New Victorian police taskforce announced in wake of 'sickening' antisemitic attacks

image.altText: A woman in a powder pink suit stands in a council office

props.synopsis: City of Nedlands Mayor Fiona Argyle launches an extraordinary broadside against some members of her council, on a day when four of them resigned.

title.children: Nedlands Mayor delivers extraordinary swipe after councillors resign

image.altText: A man fleeing the scene of an arson in Burwood last month

props.synopsis: One man slipped and fell on his back as per CCTV, while another left police with a clue as to his identity after fleeing the scene in flames.

title.children: Police hunt 'idiot amateurs' after Sydney salon arson backfires

image.altText: Robert Huber appearing in taxi dashcam footage

props.synopsis: After a two-week judge-alone trial, Robert Karl Huber is found not guilty of the murder of his partner Lindy Lucena, but guilty of manslaughter over her 2023 death.

title.children: Robert Huber found not guilty of murdering his partner in northern NSW

image.altText: A blurred man is being reprimanded by another man.

props.synopsis: NSW Police is appealing for information over the alleged murder of a 32-year-old man and its potential connection with two cases involving torture and attempted murder interstate.

title.children: 'Contract crew' potentially behind Sydney killing, kidnapping and torture

image.altText: Donald Trump in a blue suit and white USA cap speaking next to Howard Lutnick in a black suit and in front of microphones

props.synopsis: The president has taken aim at Elon Musk's "America Party", saying that it would add to voter confusion in the United States and describing the tech billionaire as a "TRAIN WRECK".

title.children: Trump calls Musk's formation of third US political party 'ridiculous'

image.altText: Men playing rugby league.

props.synopsis: The game may be played differently, but with a World Cup on the horizon and a rapid growth in players on the field, supporters say this league is "not just a sport, but a community".

title.children: Inside the game that's 'not just a sport, it's a community'

image.altText: zoo sign

props.synopsis: The woman in her 50s was bitten while watching keepers working in the carnivore enclosure at Darling Downs Zoo, south of Toowoomba, on Sunday morning.

title.children: Woman who lost arm in lion attack at zoo a member of owner's family

image.altText: A man in a blue top, jeans and a cap holds up a sign that says "hate won't bring peace" outside a white building.

props.synopsis: The attacks on Jewish people in Melbourne on Friday night should send chills down the spines of all Australians — Jewish and non-Jewish — who value diversity, culture and the right to be safe.

title.children: Melbourne's horrifying antisemitic attacks should force Australians to reject false binaries

image.altText: A man wearing a leather jacket and playing guitar at a table

props.synopsis: Australian music legend Joe Camilleri says he has been the victim of a burglary, with several valuable guitars stolen from his central Victorian home.

title.children: Australian music legend heartbroken after guitars stolen in burglary

image.altText: A smiling woman hugs an older man lying in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: A retired farmer, who has lived in the country his whole life, has been told to move to Adelaide to continue receiving life-saving dialysis, as there are no options available closer to home.

title.children: Patient faces choice of moving to city or giving up life-saving treatment

image.altText: Niti and her daughter take a selfie on the couch in their PJs

props.synopsis: For the most part Niti enjoyed being a lawyer, but having her daughter changed how she felt about the work she was doing.

title.children: My daughter is the reason I left 20 years in law to work for myself

image.altText: Yemen Houthi

props.synopsis: Israel has issued evacuation warnings for people at three Yemeni ports hours after a ship was attacked off the Red Sea port city of Hodeidah, forcing its crew to abandon it.

title.children: Israeli military strikes Houthi targets, including seized cargo ship

image.altText: A coach looks unhappy as one of her players scratches her head

props.synopsis: Although the majority of Australia's elite netball competition is thriving and breaking crowd records on a consistent basis, there are concerns a second AFL-branded team could follow Collingwood's footsteps and fold ahead of the 2026 season.

title.children: Giants' future looks uncertain in Super Netball league

image.altText: Cameron Munster hugs Harry Grant

props.synopsis: Cameron Munster's Queensland teammate Harry Grant says the captain's late father Steven would back his decision to play in the State of Origin decider.

title.children: Maroons to play for 'brave' Munster in Origin decider, says Grant

image.altText: Beau Webster, Shamar Joseph and Josh Hazlewood

props.synopsis: A telling contribution from Beau Webster, another canine cameo and a wildly swinging West Indies tail combine to hand Australia an unassailable 2-0 series lead. Here are the quick hits from day four in Grenada.

title.children: Five quick hits: More canine chaos and West Indies go down swinging

image.altText: Brown algae in water 3

props.synopsis: An ecologist says bioluminescent algae detected in South Australian waters could help fight the devastating toxic algal bloom, as calls mount to declare a national disaster.

title.children: 'Sparkle' of hope bioluminescent algae could turn the tide on toxic algal bloom

image.altText: The stick protruding through Smooch's back.

props.synopsis: Smooch the cat's owners felt a golf-ball sized lump under her skin while giving their pet a cuddle. It saved her life.

title.children: Stick 17.5cm long found in cat’s stomach with no entry or exit wound

image.altText: Firefighters fighting fire

props.synopsis: A man and a woman in their 80s are hospitalised after a suspected gas explosion at their home on the NSW North Coast.

title.children: Retirement village explosion leaves couple with 'significant' burns

image.altText: Three formally dressed men, all approaching or of middle-age, walk down a footpath next to a rusty fence.

props.synopsis: YouTube producer Kristo Langker tells a Sydney court a man who has accused Gareth Ward of indecently assaulting him was "nervous" about speaking out due to the NSW MP's "powerful" position.

title.children: friendlyjordies producer testifies in MP's sexual assault trial

image.altText: A woman leaning against a clothing rail with knitted products.

props.synopsis: The potential of four rate cuts is welcome news for millions of borrowers and business owners, but a double-edged sword for first homebuyers with property prices tipped to pick up further as a result.

title.children: Potential 'meltdown' could see four interest rate cuts by early next year

image.altText: A woman with grey hair looks into camera, there are leaves in the background.

props.synopsis: Emelia Rixon didn't know what she was signing up for when she agreed to accept power of attorney and enduring guardianship for her parents over a decade ago. Now she is caring for them as well as her children.

title.children: Reality of the 'sandwich generation', juggling kids and sick parents
